title: Define Project Requirements
description: Gather and document the detailed requirements for the CTFChallengeGenerator system. The requirements should include, but are not limited to: the types of challenges (web application vulnerabilities, network attacks, cryptography, forensics), difficulty levels (beginner, intermediate, advanced), scoring mechanisms (points, time-based, partial scoring), and integration with existing cybersecurity training platforms (CTFd, HackTheBox, TryHackMe). Consider requirements for challenge generation, deployment, submission, and evaluation processes, as well as user roles and permissions, reporting, and analytics. Additionally, include edge cases, error handling, and performance optimizations to ensure scalability and maintainability of the system. Include non-functional requirements such as security, usability, reliability, and maintainability. For further improvement, consider breaking down this task into subtasks for better manageability, especially for complex areas like error handling and performance optimizations. This will facilitate parallel work and ensure a thorough understanding and implementation of each requirement. To make the system more flexible and extendable, also consider documenting the APIs or interfaces that could be used for future integrations with other systems.

title: Design System Architecture (Revised)
description: Design the overall architecture of the CTFChallengeGenerator system, including the main components, data flows, integration points with other systems, deployment strategies, scalability considerations, and security measures. The architecture should follow best practices for maintainability, modularity, and extensibility, taking into account the latest trends in microservices architecture. This design will serve as a foundation for the development of the system.

title: Develop Challenge Generation Engine
description: Implement the core engine responsible for generating unique and scalable Capture The Flag challenges based on the defined requirements and difficulty levels.

title: Implement User Interface
description: Develop the user interface for the CTFChallengeGenerator system, allowing administrators to configure challenge parameters, difficulty levels, and scoring mechanisms.

title: Set up Database and Data Storage
description: Design and implement the database schema and data storage mechanisms for storing generated challenges, user data, and scoring information.

title: Implement Scoring and Leaderboard
description: Develop the scoring mechanisms and leaderboard functionality for tracking and displaying user progress and performance in the CTF challenges.
dependencies: Set up Database and Data Storage

title: Integrate with Cybersecurity Training Platforms
description: Implement integration mechanisms to allow the CTFChallengeGenerator system to be seamlessly integrated with existing cybersecurity training platforms and learning management systems.

title: Implement Security Measures
description: Ensure the CTFChallengeGenerator system adheres to best security practices, including secure data storage, user authentication, and protection against potential vulnerabilities.
dependencies: Set up Database and Data Storage

title: Write Documentation
description: Create comprehensive documentation for the CTFChallengeGenerator system, including installation guides, user manuals, and developer documentation.

title: Set up Continuous Integration and Deployment
description: Implement a continuous integration and deployment pipeline for the CTFChallengeGenerator system, ensuring automated testing, building, and deployment to various environments.
dependencies: Set up Database and Data Storage

title: Conduct Testing and Quality Assurance
description: Perform comprehensive testing and quality assurance activities, including unit testing, integration testing, and user acceptance testing, to ensure the CTFChallengeGenerator system meets the defined requirements and functions as expected.
